name: "Awake!" Magazine Online Quiz | Global Trivia | 10 Questions

questions.explanation:
The Golden Age.

	"Awake!" was first introduced in 1919 at a convention of Jehovah's Witnesses, but was named "The Golden Age" at the time.  As of 2007, over 34 million copies of "Awake!" are published each month.  "Daily Walking With God" is not a name "Awake!" was ever given.

questions.text: When "Awake!" first came out, it was called "Consolation."
questions.explanation:
False.

	"The Golden Age" was the original name for "Awake!"  The name has changed twice since then, and has been "Awake!" for a longer amount of time as the other two names combined.

questions.text: Which of these was never a name of "Awake!?"
questions.explanation:
Daily Walking With God.

	The name "Consolation" replaced "The Golden Age" in 1937.  The title lasted for just under ten years before it was finally renamed.  "Awake!" was renamed "Awake!" in 1946.  "Daily Walking With God" was never a title given to "Awake!"

1946.

	"Awake!" was named "Awake!" in 1946, just nine years after "Consolation."  "The Golden Age" was used for 28 years, while "Awake!" has been used for over 60 years.

questions.text: What is the "Awake!'s" longer lived and more known companion?
options: The Awake has always been placed alone
questions.explanation:
Watchtower.

	"Watchtower," previously called "Watch Tower," is used more often than "Awake!"  "Watchtower," just like "Awake!," has never missed an issue.  It has been published since 1879!

questions.text: As of 2007, how often does an issue of "Awake!" come out?
questions.explanation:
Every month.

	"Awake!" used to come out every two weeks.  "Awake!" became just one magazine a month in January of 2007.  In the back of the magazine there is a "How Would You Respond?"  This is a page that asks you questions about the Bible that the magazine can answer, and also has picture searches for children.

questions.text: When "Awake!" was biweekly, what days did it come out?
questions.explanation:
8th and 21st.

	"Watchtower" comes out every 1st and 15th, while "Awake!," before 2007, came out the 8th and 21st.  As of 2007, however, "Awake!" only comes out every month.

questions.text: How many pages does the average "Awake!" have, counting the cover and the back?
questions.explanation:
thirty-two pages.

	A very long time ago, "Awake!" had more than 32 pages.  However, many years back, it had 32 pages, and it has always been that way since.

questions.text: When "Awake!" first came out, what were the people who used them most called?
questions.explanation:
Bible Students.

	The Bible Students, later called Jehovah's Witnesses, were present at the convention when "Awake!" was introduced.  The Bible Students used the magazine as often as they could.

Jehovah's Witnesses.

	The Bible Students were renamed Jehovah's Witnesses after a Scripture in the Bible.  The scripture is Isaiah 43:10.
